questions.question: 1)   How do you pronounce ed in started?

choices.answer: A) /id/
B) /d/
C) /t/

questions.question: 2) How do you pronounce ed in looked?

choices.answer: A) /d/
C) /t/
B) /id/
A) Someone's niece is the son of their sister or brother.
Your cousin's daughter
c) She is the daughter of your sister or brother.

questions.question: 4)  What did you use to do when you were five?

choices.answer: A) I used to climb.
C)I used to play with my friends at the park.
B) I use to go out with my friends.

questions.question: 5) What was your life school like when you were four?

choices.answer: A) I had a lot of teachers at school.
C)I had a few teachers at school.
B) I did a lot of homework.

questions.question: 6) What are the differences between your parents' school at primary education and yours?

choices.answer: A) There were blackboards, but there weren't pieces of chalk at schools.
C) Students didn't use computers and mobile phones.
B) There weren't any computers, but there were whiteboards.
A) What did you do today?
C) She didn't forget the story that he told her.
B) Did you draw a picture last class? Yes, he did.

questions.question: 8) What was Barbara's job before retiring?

choices.answer: She worked as a nurse in a hospital.
She was a businessman.
She was a waiter.

questions.question: 8) What is the form of the past form and translation of forgive?

choices.answer: A) It's forgiven and perdonar.
C) It's forgave and perdonar.
B) It`s forgave and recordar
